Just pitched the rest of the season to the TVD marketing dept and there was an audible GASP.

You are ALL awful awful people. Now hug. #PLL

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) February 7, 2012

Tell me you wouldn't watch a CBS multi-camera comedy starring Ed Harris. I don't even know what it would be about, but PICTURE THAT.

Two hours is too long for a TV show. Even an awesome one.

I appreciate @tvoti's #Luck reviews. They're like Cliff Notes for the book you can't understand.

Everyone on LUCK talks like everyone on DEADWOOD minus all the cocksuckers, which is a shame.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) February 7, 2012

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
No wait, one cocksucker, right at the end of the episode. Thanks David Milch! #Luck

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) February 7, 2012

In keeping with my new role as TV's haberdasher, I can assert Nick Nolte has a terrific hat on #Luck. Like him, battered yet dignified.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) February 7, 2012

If you're upset about seeing a middle finger on TV, you're going to shit yourself when you see everything else going on in the world.

— Mike Drucker (@MikeDrucker) February 6, 2012

When hypothetical grandchildren ask where I was for the most-watched TV program in history, I'll apparently have to say I was reading.

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) February 7, 2012

Sorry haven't been tweeting today, but I'm only just coming around after seeing a middle finger on my TV yesterday.

— Brandon McCarthy (@BMcCarthy32) February 7, 2012

I'll assume at least 6 local news anchors refered to M.I.A. as "Mia" today.

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) February 7, 2012

To avoid any more controversy, next year's Super Bowl halftime show will be Kenny Rogers wearing mittens & a "Boys Don't Cry" chest bandage.

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) February 7, 2012

If Cee-Lo really wanted to mess with us, he'd change cats between each talking head segment. #thevoice

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) February 7, 2012

I want #TheVoice to do a "This is Your Life" style episode entirely of people from Christina's past that she doesn't remember.

The America presented on The Voice is in every way more appealing that the America presented on American Idol.

God help me, I am now a person who watches #TheVoice. #SuperBowlPromosWork

Why is #TheVoice so fucking uplifting and fun? I have a huge smile on my damn face. I love this shit!

These judges are everything. I might have just given up on IDOL. Thanks #TheVoice

— Kath Skerry (@KathSkerry) February 7, 2012

#TheVoice cameramen must have a special term for when the lens focus shifts from the singer to Xtina listening dreamily in her chair.

I hope #TheVoice gives Neal Middleton some health insurance as a consolation prize.

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) February 7, 2012

"Idol is more entertaining than #TheVoice." - Person who finds millionaires ridiculing mentally disturbed people entertaining

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) February 7, 2012

Since the "Voice" auditioners were all hand-picked by "Voice" producers w/eyes, the auditions are semi-blind at best.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) February 7, 2012

There is no show on TV that loves its viewers the way #Castle does. Don't believe me? Watch tonight's episode.

Oh god, y'all, this is simply delicious. #castle

AHAHAHAHAHAHA! FWHEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE! #castle

Those wine glasses they're holding tonight on HIMYM are CLEARLY a shout-out to COUGARTOWN.

— Bryan Murphy (@Bryan_Murphy) February 7, 2012

Tonight's "HIMYM" appears to spend so much time on structure that they forgot the "punchline" pass on the script.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) February 7, 2012

The piano player totally goes home every night, drinks a bottle of bourbon, and cries, right? #Glee

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) February 7, 2012

@TVandDinners The piano player is Tommy Westphall. #glee

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

I hate everything that brought us here and I still hate most of it but I kind of loved that episode. It's confusing. #GossipGirl

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) February 7, 2012

Penn Badgley is a good sport for letting them constantly make fun of his hair. #GossipGirl

— Vlada Gelman (@VladaGelman) February 7, 2012

Oh, something called SMASH starts in 5 minutes ET. Watch it, unless you hate theater and dreams and the NBC legacy and Iowa and rainbows

My McPheever is about to kick in.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) February 7, 2012

I'm going to watch the Smash pilot on iTunes while everyone else watches it on TV.

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) February 7, 2012

The Smash pilot I downloaded on iTunes has no sound. NBC is doomed.

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) February 7, 2012

I told you folks: those SCARVES are going to choke Debra Messing TO DEATH. #Smash

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) February 7, 2012

SMASH is debuting right now in the East and Midwest, according to the robocall I just got from Brian Williams. Dude sounded spent.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) February 7, 2012

So, when do the composer & lyricist start solving murders? #Smash

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

@dloehr No mystery: Truxton Spangler did it. They just can't prove it.

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) February 7, 2012

I'm going to write a song for #Smash called "50 Ways To Kill Your Annoying Assistant."

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) February 7, 2012

So when does Jack Davenport pop a pill, splash water on his face, do jazz hands & hiss, "Showtime?" #Smash

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

As far as lyricists go, D. Messing keeps a way cleaner house than I do. I've got lyrics scribbled on receipts and magazines n sh*t.

— Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) February 7, 2012

Why does Kat McPhee's boyfriend know so much about Marilyn Monroe? #Smash #creeper

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) February 7, 2012

McPhee is gorgeous and talented but in real life they would be like "Oh, Megan Hilty's here? Ok good please book her immediately" #smash

— Anna Marquardt (@ajlobster) February 7, 2012

Can't they just get Katharine McPhee to play Jackie Kennedy? #problemsolved #Smash

— Amanda Sales (@Scamandalous) February 7, 2012

So when do we see Taylor Hicks try out? #smash

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

If they'd thrown more martinis in Michael Cristofer's face, Rubicon would still be on the air. #smash

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

@misslizrichards Next week, Christina & CeeLo will be coaching them. #smash

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

@misslizrichards That's season two: Jukebox, the musical.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) February 7, 2012

My NBC affiliate just totally went black right after #Smash, like all of NBC had been building up to that moment and now it could die happy.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) February 7, 2012

All right. It is time to watch "#Smash: The Smash Williams Story." I still haven't seen #FNL, am I going to be totally lost?

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) February 7, 2012

Look: if the Smash show is a hit, then the Marilyn musical WILL go to real Broadway. And we'll have to set the whole culture on fire.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) February 7, 2012

Can the whole show just be about Michael Christofer and Angelica Huston? I would watch that show. #Smash

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) February 7, 2012

I love #Smash, but I wish Debra Messing wasn't dressed like a sad librarian. So many layers. So many patterns. So many scarves.

Am I the only one a little sad that #smash skipped the 3+ years of development & workshops & producers' notes and and and...? Just kidding.

— Julie Felise Dubiner (@jfdubiner) February 7, 2012

"Our relationship's getting deeper...I'm going to have to open up to Ben like I've never opened up." And I send daughters to bed. #bachelor

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) February 7, 2012

Jamie and Ben share what might be the most awkward televised kiss in the history of both kisses and television. Not good. #bachelor

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) February 7, 2012

Where is the black bar to cover up Ben's obscene thighs?!!!! #Bachelor

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) February 7, 2012

Jamie tells Ben she lies in bed, thinking of what she'd like to do with him. Judging by her tone, she's planning an audit. #bachelor

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) February 7, 2012

Are we just gonna sit here and accept Ben's hair? #TheBachelor

— Leslie Grossman (@MissLeslieG) February 7, 2012

Jamie doesn't know what Ben is thinking! Allow me to break it down: "Boobies, boobies, Courtney, boobies, kind of miss my dog." #bachelor

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) February 7, 2012

I could make millions of dollars as a Bachelor coach who does nothing but warn the ladies "never show him your batshit romantic scrapbook."

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) February 7, 2012

Desperately scrambling to change your ridiculous avatar pic before anyone else sees it? RT @JaredLeto: Guess what I'm doing

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) February 7, 2012

Masturbating to yourself in a candlelit chamber of mirrors? RT @JaredLeto: Guess what I'm doing

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) February 7, 2012

Interviewing Kristen Bell and not mentioning sloths is just irresponsible. I'm disappointed in you, Conan.

Sometimes when I'm watching Downton Abbey I think they're all going to break out into a spontaneous game of Clue.

The beautiful Downton Abbey really pauses me. What manner of zany trials of woe must my butler be enduring right now? I'll never know.
